00022 /**
00023  * @file   GcBg.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Sep 25 16:26:13 PDT 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing an background adjustment on all probes based
00028  * on the median intensity of probes with similar GC content.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _GCBG_H_
00031 #define _GCBG_H_
00032 
00033 #include "chipstream/PsBoard.h"

00035 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"

00046 /// String describing gc adjust algorithm/module
00047 #define GCBG "gc-bg"
00048 
00049 /**
00050  *  Class for doing an adjustment based on the median intensity of probes
00051  * with similar GC content.
00052  */
00053 class GcBg : public ChipStream {
00054 
00055 public:
00056 
00057   /** Constructor. */
00058   GcBg(int maxGc=26, bool attenuate=true, float l=0.005, float h=-1) {
00059     m_MaxGc = maxGc;
00060     m_Type = GCBG;
00061     m_ChipCount = 0;
00062     setupSelfDoc(*this);
00063     m_Attenuate = attenuate;
00064     m_L = l;
00065     m_H = h;
00066     setOptValue("attenuate", m_Attenuate);
00067     setOptValue("l", ToStr(m_L));
00068     setOptValue("h", ToStr(m_H));
00069   }
00070 
00071   /** 
00072    * Caluculates medians for different levels (bins) of GC count
00073    * between 0 and binCount in size and appends to the chipBins. The
00074    * probes vector contains a list of probes that are thought to be
00075    * representative of background at different GC counts. The
00076    * probeGcVec contains the GC count for all probes on the array.
00077    * 
00078    * @param data - One microarray's worth of data.
00079    * @param binCount - Number of bins we are calculating GC content for.
00080    * @param chipBins - Matrix of chip by gc count containing the
00081    * median intensity for a collection of gc background
00082    * probes. Ordering is chipBins[chip][gcCount] and parameters from
00083    * latest chip in data vector will be appended as last row.
00084    * @param probes - Probes to use for estimating background for particular GC bings.
00085    * @param probeGcVec - GC count of every probe on microarray indexed by id.
00086    * @param warnings - Print warnings if a particular bin is empty?
00087    * For example: print a warning if there are no probes in the GC
00088    * count zero bin.
00089    */
00090   static void learnParameters(const std::vector<float> &data, 
00091                               int binCount, 
00092                               std::vector<vector<float> > &chipBins,
00093                               std::vector<int> &probes, 
00094                               std::vector<char> &probeGcVec, 
00095                               bool warnings);
00096 
00097   /** 
00098    * Give the background adjusted intensity for a particular probe on a particular chip.
00099    * @param probeIx - Probe of interest.
00100    * @param chipIx - Set of Chips of interest.
00101    * @param intensity - Current set of intensities.
00102    * @param return - background adjusted set of intensities.
00103    */
00104   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity, PsBoard &board) {
00105     return transform(probeIx, chipIx, intensity);
00106   }
00107 
00108   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity);
00109 
00110   float transform(int probeIx, int chipIx, float intensity, int probeGc);
00111 
00112   void transform(int chipIx, std::vector<float>& intensity);
00113 
00114   void newChip(std::vector<float> &data);

00117    * @brief Method for being passed a new cel file worth of data.
00118    * @param data - vector of vectors of cel file data from same sample.
00119    */
00120   void newDataSet(IntensityMart* iMart);

00122   /** 
00123    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00124    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00125    */
00126   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00127     doc.setDocName(GCBG);
00128     doc.setDocDescription("Subtract bacground based on median intensity of probes with similar GC content.");
00129 
00130     doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00131   }
00132 
00133   /** 
00134    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00135    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00136    */
00137   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00138     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
00139 
00140     SelfDoc::Opt attenuate = {"attenuate", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "true", "true", "NA", "NA",
00141                               "Indicate whether or not to attenuate gcbg value when subtracting background. If not set then downstream algorithms must be able to handle negative values."};
00142     opts.push_back(attenuate);
00143     SelfDoc::Opt l = {"l", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.005", "0.005", "0", "1",
00144                       "Tunable parameter for attenuating gc background."};
00145     opts.push_back(l);
00146     SelfDoc::Opt h = {"h", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "-1", "-1", "-1", "NA",
00147                       "Used fixed constant to attenuate gc bacground. Default results in using 4*PM*GCBG*L."};
00148     opts.push_back(h);
00149     SelfDoc::Opt probeMd5 = {"subsetmd5", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "", "", "NA", "NA",
00150                              "Md5sum of the probe ids being used as background."};
00151     opts.push_back(probeMd5);
00152     return opts;
00153   }
00154 
00155   /** 
00156    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00157    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00158    * @return SelfDoc
00159    */
00160   static SelfDoc explainSelf() { 
00161     SelfDoc doc;
00162     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00163     return doc;
00164   }
00165 
00166   /** 
00167    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00168    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00169    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00170    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00171    * 
00172    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00173    * 
00174    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00175    */
00176   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
00177     SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00178     bool attenuate = true;
00179     float l = 0.005;
00180     float h = -1;
00181     fillInValue(attenuate, "attenuate", param, doc);
00182     fillInValue(l, "l", param, doc);
00183     fillInValue(h, "h", param, doc);
00184     GcBg *gcbg = new GcBg(26, attenuate, l, h);
00185     return gcbg;
00186   }

00189    * Setting the GC counts for all the probes on the array.
00190    * @param vec - GC count for every probe on array indexed by id.
00191    */
00192   void setProbeGcVec(const std::vector<char> &vec);

00195    * Setting the GC counts for all the probes on the array.
00196    * @param vec - GC count for every probe on array indexed by id.
00197    */
00198   void setProbeGcVec(const std::vector<unsigned char> &vec);

00200   /** 
00201    * Set the probes to use for estimating background.
00202    * @param vec - Vector of probes that are thought to be
00203    * representative of background binding.
00204    */
00205   void setControlProbes(std::vector<Probe *> &vec);
00206 
00207   /** 
00208    * Set the indexes of the probes to use for estimating background.
00209    * @param vec - Vector of probe indexes that are thought to be
00210    * representative of background binding.
00211    */
00212   void setControlProbes(std::vector<int> &vec);

00214   /**
00215    * Setup the background probes and background gc indexes by reading
00216    * them from the blackboard
00217    */
00218   void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00219 
00220 private:
00221 
00222   /// Parameters learned (median of GC background probes).
00223   std::vector<vector<float> > m_Bins;
00224   /// Probe to be used for estimating background median
00225   std::vector<int> m_BgProbes;
00226   /// GC count of each probe matching that above
00227   std::vector<char> m_BgProbeGc;
00228   /// mdsum of probe ids
00229   std::string m_ProbeMd5Sum;
00230   /// Should we use an attenuated mismatch, or simply cap the lower bounds when using non-PM-only adjuster
00231   bool m_Attenuate;
00232   /// Tunable parameter for handling background value in non-PM-only adjusters
00233   float m_L;
00234   /// Override use of computed H from data with fixed constant in background attenuation
00235   float m_H;
00236   /// How many chips have been seen.
00237   int m_ChipCount;
00238   /// Maximum GC count allowed.
00239   int m_MaxGc;
00240 };
